alert.note: Alert for Central Greenville; Greater Pickens; Greenville Mountains; Pickens Mountains (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 1:49PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Transylvania, northwestern Greenville and northeastern Pickens Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 148 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Brevard, or near Caesars Head State Park, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slater-Marietta, Pleasant Ridge State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Jones Gap State Park, Dupont State Forest, Dacusville, Cleveland, Cedar Mountain and Pumpkintown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Greenville; Greater Pickens; Greenville Mountains; Pickens Mountains
